intro: Asplenium gueinzianum, commonly known as the Gueinzian holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Aspleniaceae. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped fronds with a serrated margin, and its spores are produced on the undersides of its fertile leaves. It is often found growing in rocky crevices or on tree trunks in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying fern diversity and ecological adaptation.
